page.title: 08EVENTS IN NETHERBURY
page.content: Events take place annually, any profits usually going to local charities. Most popular are Street Fairs, Flower Shows and the weekend when private gardens are opened for public viewing. Flower Festivals are held in the churches which are beautifully decorated, often by flower arrangers, some of whom come from a distance. Craft displays are sometimes included when demonstrations of spinning, weaving, wood turning, potting, thatching can be seen together with pictures displayed by artists from the area. On Shrove Tuesday a pancake race is held at Netherbury. Pancakes must be tossed several times along a course of some 100 yds. they are not eaten! Harvest Suppers are held in all villages, the produce being autioned or distributed to the sick and elderly.
